net.mcreator.minecraft.link

Class CurrentDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.mcreator.minecraft.link.CurrentDevice

  • public final class CurrentDevice
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a helper class that provides static methods for interacting with the currently connected device.

    The device is selected in the Minecraft GUI and once it is selected, it can be controlled using commands (that call methods of this class in the background), by using Link API objects or in most cases by using this helper class.

    Example usage of this class:

    CurrentDevice.digitalWrite(13, 1);

    In this example, the pin 13 of the currently connected device is set to logic level "high".

    • Method Detail

      • pinMode

        public static void pinMode(int port,
                           PinMode pinMode)
        This method sets the pin mode of the selected pin on the current device.

        Pin mode is the mode of the pin on the device. It can be input or output. There is a special mode input_pullup too, in which case the internal pullup resitor of the connected device is enabled if it is supported by the current device.

        The output mode is used when one want to controll the logic level of the pin and input mode is used when one wants to check the input logic level of a pin on the device.

        If there is no device connected, nothing happens.

        Parameters:
        port - Port of which to set the pin mode
        pinMode - PinMode of the pin. Can be PinMode.OUT, PinMode.IN or PinMode.IN_P

      • digitalWrite

        public static void digitalWrite(int port,
                                byte val)
        This methods sets the logic level of the selected pin on the connected to the given level. The pin needs to be set to output for this method to work.

        If there is no device connected, nothing happens.

        Parameters:
        port - Port on the device of which the logic level should be set
        val - Logic level value - should be 0 for low or 1 for high

      • analogWrite

        public static void analogWrite(int port,
                               short val)
        This methods sets the analog level of the selected pin on the connected device to the given level. The pin needs to be set to output for this method to work.

        If there is no device connected, nothing happens.

        Parameters:
        port - Port on the device of which the analog level should be set
        val - Value depends on the DAC resolution. For most devices, the interval goes from 0 for the lowest voltage level and 1024 for the highest voltage level

      • digitalRead

        public static byte digitalRead(int port)
        This methods reads the digital logic level of the selected pin on the selected device.
        Parameters:
        port - Port on the device from which to read from
        Returns:
        Value of the pin which is 0 if the logic level is low, 1 if the level is high or -1 if there is no device connected

      • analogRead

        public static short analogRead(int port)
        This methods reads the analog level of the selected pin on the selected device.
        Parameters:
        port - Port on the device from which to read from
        Returns:
        Analog level of the selected port - usually in range from 0 to 1024, -1 if there is no device connected

      • enableDigitalInputEvents

        public static void enableDigitalInputEvents(int port)
        Call this method to enable digital input events on the selected port. Digital input event is called each time a logic value of the given pin changes and the events are enabled.

        If there is no device connected, nothing happens.

        Parameters:
        port - Port on which to enable digital input events
        See Also:
        LinkDigitalPinChangedEvent

      • disableDigitalInputEvents

        public static void disableDigitalInputEvents(int port)
        Call this method to disable digital input events on the selected port.

        If there is no device connected, nothing happens.

        Parameters:
        port - Port on which to enable digital input events
        See Also:
        LinkDigitalPinChangedEvent

      • sendMessage

        public static void sendMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Call this method to send a custom message to the current device.

        If there is no device connected, nothing happens.

        Parameters:
        message - The message to be sent

      • getDigitalPinsCount

        public static int getDigitalPinsCount()
        Call this method to get the number of digital inputs the current device has
        Returns:
        Number of digital inputs the device has or -1 if no device is connected

      • getAnalogPinsCount

        public static int getAnalogPinsCount()
        Call this method to get the number of analog inputs the current device has
        Returns:
        Number of analog inputs the device has or -1 if no device is connected
